meanings.definition: Hold the attention of (someone) to the exclusion of all else or so as to transfix them.
meanings.sent1: The magician mesmerises the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful artwork mesmerises visitors at the gallery.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy mesmerises the sleepy cat with its antics.
meanings.sent4: The mesmerising sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song mesmerises listeners, making them forget their worries.

meanings.definition: Captivate or hold the interest of.
meanings.sent1: The storyteller mesmerises children with her tales of adventure.
meanings.sent2: The novel mesmerises readers with its gripping plot.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of freshly baked cookies mesmerises the guests in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The dancer mesmerises the audience with her graceful movements.
meanings.sent5: The starry night sky mesmerises observers, filling them with wonder.
